p: The proportion of respondents who had adopted “washing hands after touching poultry feces” (72.3%), “washing hands after touching dead poultry” (68.5%), and “wearing protective clothes” (59.6%) was higher than that of the other PPBs. Of note, 6.8% of poultry farmers had never adopted “wearing face mask” and 4.9% had never adopted “wearing gloves” while working ( Figure 4).
